div.p: DATEOFPUBLICATION and ORIGINALDATEOFPUBLICATION are fields in the Bibliography Database which record the publication date(s) of the work you are listing. They also have fields for Date Value, Sort Date or Date Reg, No Date and Emended Date.
Enter the date of publication if known in the DATEOFPUBLICATION field. For books, enter a year date only. For newspaper articles, etc, enter the date as day month year: 23 January 1978.

DATEOFPUBLICATION is the default field for publication dates. It contains the original date of publication for each text unless you are citing a reprint or new edition and want to differentiate between the date of that version and the date when the work was first published. Sort Date, or Date Reg, records the date to be used for sorting purposes in the bibliography database. Typically, the sort date for books is the year of publication followed by two hyphens: 1923--. For journal articles it takes the form year-month or year-month-day: 1978-01- or 1978-01-23. In the case of entire journals or a work published in successive volumes, where the DATEOFPUBLICATION spans more than a year (1752-3 or January 1850 to December 1870), the Sort Date is by first appearance: 1752-- or 1850-01-.
If you do not have a date of publication, select No Date.

If you are supplying an emended date -- supplying a date for a book with no date of publication on the title page, or correcting an incorrect date on a title page -- do not enter the emended date in square brackets. Enter the correct date in the DATEOFPUBLICATION field and select the emended date option; the square brackets will be rendered through style sheets.
